SHORT_DESCR.P: Provision of an outcomes focused housing support service, which will be delivered to people aged 16 years and over who are homeless or at the risk of being homeless.

The service will deliver an outcomes focused Outreach housing support service for clients who are homeless or at the risk of being homeless. Individuals referred to this service will come from a range of backgrounds with varying levels of complexity depending on where they are in their life’s journey; and may also have a range of health needs e.g. mental health, learning disabilities, physical disability, substance misuse etc.

The purpose of the support is to enable clients to make the successful transition to independent living and tenancy sustainment provided from a range of accommodation, including, but not limited to, supported, temporary, shared, private/secure tenancies and family homes.

The support provided will be tailored to meet the needs of each client, providing those with the necessary life skills to make the most out of their lives giving them a better quality of life and to support them meet their full potential.

The support will be flexible to meet the clients’ changing needs, with a key aim to enable clients’ to sustain and maintain their tenancies. Provision of a housing support service for clients’ needs and inputs will vary as they progress through their individual journeys.

Currently, approximately 139 hours per week of housing support is commissioned from the independent care and support sector in Aberdeenshire. The approximate hours are given as a guide only and is not a guarantee of hours. The contract will be a single supplier framework agreement and all call off orders will be spot purchased.

Main Settlements, Auchnagatt, Fetterangus, New Leeds, St Fergus, Boddam, Hatton, New Pitsligo, Strichen, Crimond, Longside, OldDeer, Stuartfield, Clola, Maud, Peterhead, Longhaven, Cruden Bay, Mintlaw, St Combs and Knaven.
The townships in the table are given as a guide only. Clients may live out with towns and villages in rural Buchan.

INFO_ADD.P: The maximum hourly rate is 18.05 GBP The maximum social mileage rate per mile is 0.45 GBP.
Note this is not a social work service. This service is being commissioned by Aberdeenshire Council Housing — Homeless service.

The purpose of this Prior information notice (PIN) is to determine whether suitability qualified providers may be interested in providing an outcomes focused Outreach housing support service for clients who are homeless or at the risk of being homeless within Aberdeenshire.

The notice Acts as early notification to the market of Aberdeenshire Council's intention to publish an invitation to tender for Outreach housing support services in 4 lots for people who are homeless or at the risk of being homeless in May 2018.

A providers event has been arranged for Thursday 3.5.2018, 13.30 to 15.00 hours, The Bunker, Gordon House, Blackhall Road, Inverurie, AB51 3WA. The event will provide potential bidders with an opportunity to find out more about the procurement and ask any questions.

Note: To register your interest in this notice and obtain any additional information please visit the Public Contracts Scotland Web Site at http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/Search/Search_Switch.aspx?ID=536304
